original_title: Sri Lanka military to claim expenses of unreturned military athletes from France
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka military, in line with a signed bond, is considering recovering the expenses for seven military personnel who failed to return to the island following the World Military Triathlon Championship in France concluded last week.

Sri Lanka sent a contingent of 13 athletes from the tri-forces to France’s Southwestern Brive-la-Gaillarde to participate in the World Triathlon Championship during the first week of May. Only 6 athletes returned on Saturday (13).

Seven members, including four from the Army, two of the Air Force, and one member from the Navy, have failed to return with them and went missing a day before their return flight to Sri Lanka, Army Spokesman Ravi Herath told EconomyNext

Prior to participating in events abroad, athletes had signed a bond that includes the signatures of close relatives or a subordinate, who will be liable to pay back all expenses incurred by the tri-forces for the athlete in case of non-return.
“If they return, they will have to take legal resignation from the force, and expenses incurred by the forces in sending them to these foreign tournaments need to be repaid as well,” Herath said.
“We have already informed all the immigration and emigration departments in both countries.” (Colombo/ May 15/2023)
